abstract: Chinese Pres Xi Jinping arrives in Washington State on first leg of visit to United States, saying in speech he will team with US to fight cybercrime; discussion appears aimed at reassuring business audience, many of whom represent tech industries at the forefront of cyberspace issues; tone of address is positive but many feel credibility of his statements remains to be seen.
lead_paragraph: The president faced a crowd concerned over China’s barriers to market access, rampant commercial cybertheft and the imposition of intrusive security measures.

headline.main: Xi Jinping Pledges to Work With U.S. to Stop Cybercrimes
headline.print_headline: China’s Premier Pledges to Help U.S. Stop Cybercrimes

snippet: The president faced a crowd concerned over China’s barriers to market access, rampant commercial cybertheft and the imposition of intrusive security measures.
